body.p: The canonical way of applying patches in ebuilds is to use epatch (from epatch.eclass, which you must make sure to inherit!) inside src_prepare. This function automatically handles -p levels, gunzip and so on as necessary.
Starting with EAPI=7, this function is banned and eapply must be used.
Beginning with EAPI=6, a new function eapply was added to apply patches without the need for an eclass. This function differs from epatch in several ways:

ul.li: eapply will not unpack patches for you.
The default patch level is -p1. Other patch levels must be specified manually or the command will fail.
When specifying a directory, at least one file with a name ending in .patch or .diff must exist or the command fails. Other files are ignored.

body.p: Note that distributing modified tarballs rather than a vanilla tarball and patches is highly discouraged.
The default src_prepare function will look for a global PATCHES array to apply a list of patches for you.

tr.ti: Specifies the directory in which epatch looks for patches.
Force epatch to apply patches even if they do not follow the canonical naming form (set to yes).

body.p: Bulk patches should be named in the form ??_${ARCH}_foo.${EPATCH_SUFFIX}. If they are not, EPATCH_FORCE="yes" must be set. To apply a patch on all archs, use all for the ${ARCH} part.
